title: Investigation launched after child's body found on electric railway line in Bootle
text:
An investigation has been launched after a 12-year-old child was found dead on an electric railway line in the Bootle area of Liverpool.

Emergency services were called to the tracks near Bedford Road shortly after 7pm on Monday evening following reports that two children had been spotted walking on the lines.

It was later reported that the body of a 12-year-old child had been recovered from the area.

A British Transport Police spokeswoman said: "Officers were called to the line in Bootle shortly after 7pm last night following reports of a casualty on the tracks.

"Paramedics also attended. However, sadly, a person was pronounced dead at the scene.

"The incident is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be prepared for the coroner."

The spokeswoman did not confirm any details of the deceased.
description: An investigation has been launched after a 12-year-old child was found dead on an electric railway line in the Bootle area of Liverpool.
